snippet: Michael George Patterson tells of his impending death to Alaskan youths, who have been found to not respond to fear-inducing imagery of disease and shortened life.
abstract: Michael George Patterson, 59-year-old Native Alaskan lifelong smoker who is chronically ill, tells high school students in Juneau about his impending death and encourages them to avoid smoking; is one of more than two dozen people selected by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to speak out against tobacco use.
lead_paragraph: Michael George Patterson tells of his impending death to Alaskan youths, who have been found to not respond to fear-inducing imagery of disease and shortened life.

headline.main: Antismoking Story That Is Tailored to Native Alaskans
headline.print_headline: Antismoking Story That Is Tailored to Native Alaskans

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
